title: Kinetic Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (keGFR)
desc: The Kinetic Glomerular Filtration Rate (kGFR) estimates GFR in patients with acutely changing creatinine.

orgreference.text: Chen S. Retooling the creatinine clearance equation to estimate kinetic GFR when the plasma creatinine is changing acutely. J Am Soc Nephrol. 2013;24(6):877-88.

data.evidence:
Take two serum creatinine measurements (Cr1 and Cr2), at two different time points (time1 and time2).

where variables are as follows:

Variable*

Definition

Crbaseline

Baseline creatinine, mg/dL

CrCl

Initial creatinine clearance, mL/min (by MDRD equation)

Crmean

Average of Cr1 and Cr2

time2 – time1

Time between measured Cr2 and Cr1, hrs

*The second portion of the equation, i.e., 1 – [(24 x (Cr2 – Cr1)) / ((time2 – time1) x 1.5)], is a multiplier limited to 0-1. 

Note: formula assumes US units. For SI formula, see O’Sullivan 2017.
data.facts:
Interpretation:

KeGFR of 30 mL/min is 90% specific (71% sensitive) for AKI, according to one small retrospective study (O'Sullivan 2017).

inputs.label_en: Unintentional weight loss during the last three to six months.
inputs.name: age

inputs.label_en: The patient has not eaten in excess of five days and is in critical condition.
inputs.name: Cr
race
inputs.tips_en: Race may/may not provide better estimates of GFR; optional
